intro: Myosotis traversii var. cinerascens, commonly known as the silver cineraria, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, sky-blue to white flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but is considered rare in the wild.
